metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5209 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
An Information Disclosure vulnerability exists in NTP 4.2.7p25 private(mode 6/7) messages via a GET_RESTRICT control message, which could let amalicious user obtain sensitive information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5209` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1
sntp - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ntp package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1').
